meanings.definition: Lead or guide (someone) to a particular place or destination.
meanings.sent1: The tour guide reconducted the group to the museum.
meanings.sent2: She reconducted the lost hiker back to the main trail.
meanings.sent3: The confused cat reconducted itself to the familiar path home.
meanings.sent4: The melody reconducted the audience to a nostalgic memory.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reconducted the students through the steps of the experiment.

meanings.definition: Conduct (an event or activity) again or differently.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra reconducted the symphony for the encore.
meanings.sent2: They reconducted the meeting to address the new information.
meanings.sent3: The chef reconducted the cooking class with a spicy twist.
meanings.sent4: The director reconducted the play with a modern interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The coach reconducted the practice session to focus on defense strategies.

meanings.definition: Bring (someone) back to a particular state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The therapist reconducted her patient to a place of calm.
meanings.sent2: He reconducted his friend to a state of happiness after the setback.
meanings.sent3: The magic trick reconducted the volunteer to a state of surprise.
meanings.sent4: The song reconducted her to a state of nostalgia for her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh cookies reconducted him to a state of comfort.
